bio: Jane Lombard is a partner in the firm’s Philadelphia office and department chair of the Worker’s Compensation Group. She focuses her practice on representing Pennsylvania self-insured employers and insurers in workers’ compensation matters, advising employers in the pre-litigation phase and handling all matters before WC Judges and through the Appellate levels. A seasoned trial attorney, she has argued several cases before the Pennsylvania Supreme Court and Pennsylvania Commonwealth Court. She’s been voted a Top rated Workers’ Compensation Attorney in Philadelphia by SuperLawyers since 2005, and has been named among the top 50 female attorneys in Pennsylvania numerous times.

Beyond her casework, Ms. Lombard enjoys writing and speaking on workers’ compensation topics. She has been a seminar presenter for the Pennsylvania Bar Institute, Pennsylvania Defense Institute, National Business Institute, Lorman, and individual employers and insurers throughout Pennsylvania. She has also published articles on the subject in the Pennsylvania Self-Insurance Association newsletter and the Legal Intelligencer.

Ms. Lombard graduated cum laude from LaSalle University with a Bachelor’s degree in Political Science. She earned her J.D. from Pennsylvania State University Dickinson School of Law. She is a past co-chair of the Philadelphia Bar Association WC Section and a current member of the Philadelphia Bar Association, Pennsylvania Bar Association, and Pennsylvania Defense Institute.
